data.text: Sub-Saharan Africa is projected to grow at 3.2% in 2019 and 3.6% in 2020. What does this mean for the youthful population? Join IMF's Abebe Selassie, @JoyDoreenBiira and @IEAKwame for a LIVE discussion on October 27 at 3:30pm EAT (12:30pm GMT). https://t.co/D5dAKBztIL #IMFAfrica

Gaps between better and worse performing regions in many advanced economies are widening. Read the latest #IMFBlog to find out which policies can help narrow these gaps #WEO https://t.co/qCgz5h40iz https://t.co/C4Nv4DVWrt

What is the state of the global economy and what options to policymakers have to deal with risks? @CNBC’s @GeoffCutmore gives his take on this seminar. https://t.co/qA7dDRVZWT #IMFmeetings #GlobalEcon https://t.co/O6xAtL7ifF

Stronger banking systems, greater foreign currency reserve holdings, and central bank swap lines can mitigate potential impact of a #Dollar disruption https://t.co/xtdPoXMiUM #GFSR #IMFBlog https://t.co/3fc0IxvJvF

Governments will need to increase the price of carbon emissions to give people and firms incentives to reduce energy use and shift to clean energy sources. Learn more about mitigating #ClimateChange through fiscal policy in our #FiscalMonitor

The global economy is now in a synchronized slowdown in part because of rising trade barriers and increasing geopolitical tensions. See the latest #WEO projections. Find out more about the prospects for the economy in the #IMFBlog https://t.co/xErxkTQ8xX https://t.co/jLPHMmtsq6

Over the past year, IMF policy advice has focused on supporting international cooperation while responding to its member needs. Read our Annual Report to find out more.

We need to look at the whole financial ecosystem, because everything is interconnected. A central bank’s job is to ensure financial stability. We also want to enable innovation. — @BankOfEngland Governor Mark Carney on regulating tech giants in finance #IMFmeetings #fintech https://t.co/bafMV3ltW1

We used to pay US$ 1.50 a minute for an international phone call. Today, it’s for free with the internet. Banking services have not evolved the same way. — @DavidMarcus, Head of @Calibra at the 2019 Annual #IMFmeetings https://t.co/BYz5cr4FFL #NewEcon #fintech https://t.co/l0UHF20IMj

The best way to reduce carbon emissions & limit global warming is to put a price of $75 per ton of CO2 on them.
